Accessing section-specific data

Some mentors have coordinated with the methodology staff and DSMLP to provide only the students in their section access to data on DSMLP. This data lives in section-specific folders that only the students in their section have access to.

Hereâ€™s how to launch a server on DSMLP in a way that you can access this section-specific data. For the purposes of this example, we will assume you want to use the vanilla launch-scipy-ml.sh launch script, but these steps work with any launch script and flags. Also, note that here â€œteamâ€ and â€œsectionâ€ mean the same thing; by â€œteamâ€ we donâ€™t mean your projectâ€™s team.

  1. ssh onto DSMLP as usual. Donâ€™t run any launch scripts yet.
  2. Run launch-scipy-ml.sh -W DSC180A_FA22_A00 -G list. Note that this wonâ€™t actually launch a server â€“ instead, this will list all of the groups you are a part of. You should see a row that contains your capstone section number for the â€œTeam,â€ like DSC 180A - A14 [88137] in the example below. Copy the â€œTeam IDâ€ (dsc180aa1488137100014352 in the example below).

Note: If you donâ€™t see the right team information at this step, contact Suraj.

  1. Run launch-scipy-ml.sh -W DSC180A_FA22_A00 -G <teamid>, with <teamid> replaced with the Team ID you copied earlier. If youâ€™re in section A14 like in the example above, youâ€™d run launch-scipy-ml.sh -W DSC180A_FA22_A00 -G dsc180aa1488137100014352.

  2. After your server launches, run ls. You should see three folders â€“ private, public, and teams. Your home directory is in private (thatâ€™s where all your code should live). The public folder contains files that the methodology course staff may share with the entire course.

  3. To find your section-specific data, cd into teams. Run ls to see a list of all of the teams in the course and identify the name of yours. This may look like the example below. If, again, youâ€™re in section A14, your team-specific folder is "dsc-180a---a14-[88137]" (the quotes are important). If you cd into that folder, youâ€™ll see the files that your mentor uploaded for you!

All you need to do now is access the data in your teamâ€™s folder from your code in the private folder! For instance, from a script at the root of your private folder, a path to a file in your teamâ€™s folder might be "../teams/dsc-180a---a14-[88137]/example.txt".
